title: What type of music does Trump listen to? - Quora
tags: Culture of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Hippie stuff. Seriously Donald Trump might be all about the business at face value but when he decides to put some tunes on he likes a bit of CSNY and particularly the work of Neil Young "He's got something very special. I've listened to his music for years and I've seen him before that, but I went to the concert where they were honoring Bob Dylan years ago at Madison Square Garden and Neil got up and totally brought the house down. There was nobody close. He's performed for me at my casinos over the years and he just brings it down. I've met him on occasions and he's a terrific guy. … His voice is perfect and haunting. He's 63 and I don't think it's changed." Neil doesn’t seem to reciprocate the love. Although apparently he also likes the old style crooners "There's so much great music. For me, I'd have to say it's a toss up between Frank Sinatra, Tony Bennett, and Elton John. I never get tired of listening to them and probably never will… Any album by any of them is bound to be fantastic. And also Eminem who he thinks is “fantastic” along with Toots and the Maytals. He’s just a regular hippie, crooner, reggae, hip hop fan. Complete Guide to the 2016 Candidates' Favorite Music Donald Trump's unexpected thoughts on music - revealed

From what I can see, he doesn’t seem to care much for the arts, theater, or classical music nor does he promote American genres of music. The Obama’s had several specials with different artists. I think one was the blues, another was country western music, and another highlighted songs from famous movies. It’s been awhile and I don’t remember exact details but suffice it to say the Obama’s tried to bring the arts to more people, not less. Maybe 45 really doesn’t prefer any particular genre of music or maybe he just has too short of attention span? It’s odd how he claims to have so much money but he doesn’t seem to have any of the habits of one who appreciates the finer things in life. Many people of substance acquire art for their private gallery and have an awareness and appreciation for great pieces that will appreciate in value. The same people often are foodies and really enjoy a meal by an “iron chef.” A well done steak slathered in ketchup is NOT a gourmet meal and using the large gold WH candelabras on either end of a large banquet table of lukewarm fast food is not a testimony to good taste. Charlie the tuna could do a better job.

He only listens to one song and that’s “Nellie the Elephant”. Its the only tune that panders to his ego enough by mentioning “Trump” enough times. Sorry- I couldn’t help it. In all seriousness he listens to the kind of music that you and I listen to: Beethoven, Wagner, Anton Bruckner, Hans Hotter, Herbert von Karajan, Clemens Krauss, Elly Nelly, Hans Pfitzner, Li Stadelmann and Richard Strauss to name but a few.

According to Penn Jillette on Joe Rogan’s Podcast, Trump has no real love or understanding of music. This might be why when you seek an answer to that question, you get lots of quotes from his books or interviews of very shallow enjoyment of a wide range of music. There’s not a single recorded moment in print or video of Trump discussing music he really loves and why. I’m inclined to believe Mr. Jillette and others, and say that Trump just doesn’t get music at all, and sees it as background noise.

I love some of the previous answers. That said, my own opinion is that he is tone deaf in the heart, so not much music can have meaning for him or stir him emotionally. I would imagine that his favorite song is. “Hail to the chief”. It was quite a disappointment to see that he doesn’t know the words of the NATIONAL ANTHEM, nor does he know behaviors expected of a person when it plays. And he complains when a person takes a knee.
The sound of his own voice.
His favorite song is the theme from ''TELETUBBIES''.
Rap, straight up old school. NWA, Public Enemy, Schooly D… Also, a big fan of mariachi bands.
I think he likes AC/DC’s Moneytalks, but probably has his own version ;)
The sound of applause from an adoring crowd is music to his ears!
